alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 11 at 3:23AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions ongoing. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Wind gusts as high as 55 mph will create whiteout conditions. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
